Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 5+ family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of all residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of condominiums that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Serious housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All violations that HPD defines as class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Severe crowding rate (% of renter households)
Indicator Description: The share of all renter households in which there are more than 1.5 household members for each room in the unit.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Total housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All HPD violations defined as class A ('non-hazardous'), class B ('hazardous'), and class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Population density (1,000 persons per square mile)
Indicator Description: The geographic area's population divided by its land area and is reported in thousands of people per square mile.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Units authorized by new residential building permits
Indicator Description: The number of units authorized by new residential building permits is derived from the building permit and jobs reports of the DOB.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Units issued new certificates of occupancy
Indicator Description: The number of residential units in buildings issued new certificates of occupancy issued by the DOB each year.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The percentage of workers who commute primarily by foot, bicycle, or public transportation, as a share of all workers over the age of 16 who do not work at home.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The mean commute time in minutes for commuters residing in the geographic area.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Residential units within 1/2 mile of a subway station
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a half mile walk of a station entrance for the New York City Subway, Long Island Rail Road, PATH, Amtrak, Metro-North Railroad, or Staten Island Railway.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Residential units within 1/4 mile of a park
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a quarter mile of a park.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The number of serious crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Students performing at grade level in English language arts, 4th grade
Indicator Description: The percentage of fourth-grade students performing at or above grade level in English language arts in 4th grade (termed 'proficient').

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Students performing at grade level in math, 4th grade
Indicator Description: The percentage of fourth-grade students performing at or above grade level in math in 4th grade (termed 'proficient').

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator: Housing choice vouchers (% of occupied, privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: The share of all rental households in privately owned units whose occupants use a housing choice voucher from HUD.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The median gross rent among 2-3 bedroom units, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Name: Flatlands/Canarsie
Indicator Description: The median gross rent, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Indicator Description: The median rent that landlords advertise for housing units available for rent.

Indicator Description: The median gross rent among studios and 1-bedroom units, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of city residents who were born in New York State.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of the adult population who have disabilities that impair hearing, vision, ambulation, cognition, self-care, or independent living.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The share of the population that is born outside the United States or Puerto Rico.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Households with children under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The percentage of households living with children under 18.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The income earned by the 80th percentile household divided by the income earned by the 20th percentile household for a given geographic area, excluding all households without positive income.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older who are in the civilian labor force, divided by the total number of non-institutionalized people aged 16 years and older.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The median household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The median owner-occupied household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The median renter household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as Asian (non-Hispanic).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as black (non-Hispanic).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as Hispanic (of any race).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as white (non-Hispanic).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: All people, both children and adults, living in a given geographic area.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Population aged 25+ with a bachelor's degree or higher
Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have attained a bachelor's degree or higher.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Population aged 25+ without a high school diploma
Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have not graduated from high school or received a GED.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The percentage of residents who are aged 65 years and older.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of people below the poverty threshold divided by the number of people for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 65 or older below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Poverty rate, population under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The number of people under 18 years old below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The probability that two randomly chosen people in a given geographic area will be of a different race.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The share of households that include only one person.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force who are unemployed, divided by the total number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: FHA/VA-backed home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied home, condominium, or cooperative apartment that were insured or guaranteed by the FHA or VA, as reported by HMDA.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Higher-cost refinance loans (% of refinance loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of loan originations, for the refinancing of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of first-lien home purchase loan originations for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, or cooperative apartments  divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Home purchase loans in LMI tracts (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loans, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartments, that were originated for homes in low- to moderate-income census tracts.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Home purchase loans to LMI borrowers (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of owner-occupied units divided by the total number of occupied housing units.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of housings units, which can include a house, apartment, mobile home, group of rooms, or single room that is occupied (or is vacant and intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 1 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 1 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 2-4 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 2-4 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 5+ family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 5+ family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, all property types
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same properties of any type (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, condominium
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same condominiums (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 1 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for one unit buildings.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 2-4 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for two- to four-unit buildings.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 5+ family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for multifamily buildings.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, condominium ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for condominiums.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The rate of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated per 1,000 1-4 family properties and condominium units.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, all residential properties
Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose
Indicator Description: The number of refinance loans for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments in the given geographic.

Name: Mott Haven/Melrose

Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of owner-occupied units divided by the total number of occupied housing units.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of housings units, which can include a house, apartment, mobile home, group of rooms, or single room that is occupied (or is vacant and intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 1 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 1 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 2-4 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 2-4 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 5+ family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 5+ family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, all property types
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same properties of any type (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, condominium
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same condominiums (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 1 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for one unit buildings.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 2-4 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for two- to four-unit buildings.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 5+ family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for multifamily buildings.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, condominium ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for condominiums.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The rate of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated per 1,000 1-4 family properties and condominium units.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, all residential properties
Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of refinance loans for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments in the given geographic.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of vacant, habitable, for-rent units divided by the number of renter-occupied units plus vacant, habitable, for-rent units.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 1 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 2-4 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 5+ family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of all residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of condominiums that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Serious housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All violations that HPD defines as class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Severe crowding rate (% of renter households)
Indicator Description: The share of all renter households in which there are more than 1.5 household members for each room in the unit.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Total housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All HPD violations defined as class A ('non-hazardous'), class B ('hazardous'), and class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Population density (1,000 persons per square mile)
Indicator Description: The geographic area's population divided by its land area and is reported in thousands of people per square mile.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Units authorized by new residential building permits
Indicator Description: The number of units authorized by new residential building permits is derived from the building permit and jobs reports of the DOB.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Units issued new certificates of occupancy
Indicator Description: The number of residential units in buildings issued new certificates of occupancy issued by the DOB each year.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The percentage of workers who commute primarily by foot, bicycle, or public transportation, as a share of all workers over the age of 16 who do not work at home.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The mean commute time in minutes for commuters residing in the geographic area.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Residential units within 1/2 mile of a subway station
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a half mile walk of a station entrance for the New York City Subway, Long Island Rail Road, PATH, Amtrak, Metro-North Railroad, or Staten Island Railway.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Residential units within 1/4 mile of a park
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a quarter mile of a park.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of serious crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Students performing at grade level in English language arts, 4th grade
Indicator Description: The percentage of fourth-grade students performing at or above grade level in English language arts in 4th grade (termed 'proficient').

Name: Riverdale/Fieldston
Indicator: Students performing at grade level in math, 4th grade
Indicator Description: The percentage of fourth-grade students performing at or above grade level in math in 4th grade (termed 'proficient').

Indicator Description: The median gross rent, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Name: Parkchester/Soundview

Name: Parkchester/Soundview
Indicator Description: The percentage of the adult population who have disabilities that impair hearing, vision, ambulation, cognition, self-care, or independent living.

Name: Parkchester/Soundview
Indicator Description: The probability that two randomly chosen people in a given geographic area will be of a different race.

Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Throgs Neck/Co-op City

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The income earned by the 80th percentile household divided by the income earned by the 20th percentile household for a given geographic area, excluding all households without positive income.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older who are in the civilian labor force, divided by the total number of non-institutionalized people aged 16 years and older.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown

Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as white (non-Hispanic).

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The percentage of residents who are aged 65 years and older.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The number of people below the poverty threshold divided by the number of people for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 65 or older below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator: Poverty rate, population under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The number of people under 18 years old below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The probability that two randomly chosen people in a given geographic area will be of a different race.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator Description: The share of households that include only one person.

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown

Name: Lower East Side/Chinatown
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force who are unemployed, divided by the total number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: FHA/VA-backed home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied home, condominium, or cooperative apartment that were insured or guaranteed by the FHA or VA, as reported by HMDA.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Higher-cost refinance loans (% of refinance loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of loan originations, for the refinancing of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator Description: The number of first-lien home purchase loan originations for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, or cooperative apartments  divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Home purchase loans in LMI tracts (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loans, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartments, that were originated for homes in low- to moderate-income census tracts.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Home purchase loans to LMI borrowers (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator Description: The number of owner-occupied units divided by the total number of occupied housing units.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator Description: The number of housings units, which can include a house, apartment, mobile home, group of rooms, or single room that is occupied (or is vacant and intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 1 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 1 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 2-4 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 2-4 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 5+ family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 5+ family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, all property types
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same properties of any type (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, condominium
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same condominiums (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 1 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for one unit buildings.

Name: Upper West Side

Indicator Description: The median price per unit for two- to four-unit buildings.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 5+ family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for multifamily buildings.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, condominium ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for condominiums.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The rate of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated per 1,000 1-4 family properties and condominium units.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, all residential properties
Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Upper West Side
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Upper West Side

Indicator Description: The geographic area's population divided by its land area and is reported in thousands of people per square mile.

Indicator Description: The number of residential units in buildings issued new certificates of occupancy issued by the DOB each year.

Name: Central Harlem
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Central Harlem
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Central Harlem

Name: Central Harlem

Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Central Harlem
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of city residents who were born in New York State.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of the adult population who have disabilities that impair hearing, vision, ambulation, cognition, self-care, or independent living.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The share of the population that is born outside the United States or Puerto Rico.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Households with children under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The percentage of households living with children under 18.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The income earned by the 80th percentile household divided by the income earned by the 20th percentile household for a given geographic area, excluding all households without positive income.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older who are in the civilian labor force, divided by the total number of non-institutionalized people aged 16 years and older.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The median household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The median owner-occupied household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The median renter household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as Asian (non-Hispanic).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as black (non-Hispanic).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as Hispanic (of any race).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as white (non-Hispanic).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: All people, both children and adults, living in a given geographic area.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Population aged 25+ with a bachelor's degree or higher
Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have attained a bachelor's degree or higher.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Population aged 25+ without a high school diploma
Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have not graduated from high school or received a GED.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The percentage of residents who are aged 65 years and older.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of people below the poverty threshold divided by the number of people for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 65 or older below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Poverty rate, population under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The number of people under 18 years old below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The probability that two randomly chosen people in a given geographic area will be of a different race.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The share of households that include only one person.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force who are unemployed, divided by the total number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: FHA/VA-backed home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied home, condominium, or cooperative apartment that were insured or guaranteed by the FHA or VA, as reported by HMDA.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Higher-cost refinance loans (% of refinance loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of loan originations, for the refinancing of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of first-lien home purchase loan originations for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, or cooperative apartments  divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Home purchase loans in LMI tracts (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loans, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartments, that were originated for homes in low- to moderate-income census tracts.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Home purchase loans to LMI borrowers (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of owner-occupied units divided by the total number of occupied housing units.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of housings units, which can include a house, apartment, mobile home, group of rooms, or single room that is occupied (or is vacant and intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 1 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 1 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 2-4 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 2-4 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 5+ family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 5+ family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, all property types
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same properties of any type (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, condominium
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same condominiums (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 1 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for one unit buildings.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 2-4 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for two- to four-unit buildings.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 5+ family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for multifamily buildings.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, condominium ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for condominiums.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The rate of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated per 1,000 1-4 family properties and condominium units.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, all residential properties
Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of refinance loans for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments in the given geographic.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of vacant, habitable, for-rent units divided by the number of renter-occupied units plus vacant, habitable, for-rent units.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 1 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 2-4 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 5+ family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of all residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of condominiums that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Serious housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All violations that HPD defines as class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Severe crowding rate (% of renter households)
Indicator Description: The share of all renter households in which there are more than 1.5 household members for each room in the unit.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Total housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All HPD violations defined as class A ('non-hazardous'), class B ('hazardous'), and class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Woodside/Sunnyside
Indicator: Population density (1,000 persons per square mile)

Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loans, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartments, that were originated for homes in low- to moderate-income census tracts.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Home purchase loans to LMI borrowers (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of owner-occupied units divided by the total number of occupied housing units.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of housings units, which can include a house, apartment, mobile home, group of rooms, or single room that is occupied (or is vacant and intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 1 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 1 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 2-4 family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 2-4 family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, 5+ family building
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same 5+ family properties (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, all property types
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same properties of any type (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, condominium
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same condominiums (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 1 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for one unit buildings.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 2-4 family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for two- to four-unit buildings.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, 5+ family building ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for multifamily buildings.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Median sales price per unit, condominium ($2017)
Indicator Description: The median price per unit for condominiums.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The rate of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated per 1,000 1-4 family properties and condominium units.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, all residential properties
Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of refinance loans for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments in the given geographic.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of vacant, habitable, for-rent units divided by the number of renter-occupied units plus vacant, habitable, for-rent units.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 1 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 2-4 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 5+ family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of all residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of condominiums that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Serious housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All violations that HPD defines as class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Severe crowding rate (% of renter households)
Indicator Description: The share of all renter households in which there are more than 1.5 household members for each room in the unit.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Total housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All HPD violations defined as class A ('non-hazardous'), class B ('hazardous'), and class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Population density (1,000 persons per square mile)
Indicator Description: The geographic area's population divided by its land area and is reported in thousands of people per square mile.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Units authorized by new residential building permits
Indicator Description: The number of units authorized by new residential building permits is derived from the building permit and jobs reports of the DOB.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Units issued new certificates of occupancy
Indicator Description: The number of residential units in buildings issued new certificates of occupancy issued by the DOB each year.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The percentage of workers who commute primarily by foot, bicycle, or public transportation, as a share of all workers over the age of 16 who do not work at home.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The mean commute time in minutes for commuters residing in the geographic area.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Residential units within 1/2 mile of a subway station
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a half mile walk of a station entrance for the New York City Subway, Long Island Rail Road, PATH, Amtrak, Metro-North Railroad, or Staten Island Railway.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Residential units within 1/4 mile of a park
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a quarter mile of a park.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of serious crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Students performing at grade level in English language arts, 4th grade
Indicator Description: The percentage of fourth-grade students performing at or above grade level in English language arts in 4th grade (termed 'proficient').

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Students performing at grade level in math, 4th grade
Indicator Description: The percentage of fourth-grade students performing at or above grade level in math in 4th grade (termed 'proficient').

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator: Housing choice vouchers (% of occupied, privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: The share of all rental households in privately owned units whose occupants use a housing choice voucher from HUD.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The median gross rent among 2-3 bedroom units, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The median gross rent, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The median rent that landlords advertise for housing units available for rent.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The median gross rent among studios and 1-bedroom units, which includes the amount agreed to or specified in the lease regardless of whether furnishings, utilities, or services are included; and estimated monthly electricity and heating fuel costs paid by the renter.

Indicator Description: The share of renter households whose gross rent made up at least 30 percent of their monthly pre-tax income.

Indicator Description: The share of low-income renter households whose gross rent made up at least 30 percent of their monthly pre-tax income.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The share of moderate-income renter households whose gross rent made up at least 30 percent of their monthly pre-tax income.

Indicator Description: The share of all rental units located in New York City Housing Authority public housing.

Name: Jackson Heights

Indicator Description: The share of occupied, recently available rental units that are affordable to appropriately sized households with incomes at 80 of the Area Median Income.

Indicator Description: The share of renter households whose gross rent made up at least 50 percent of their monthly pre-tax income.

Indicator Description: The share of low-income renter households whose gross rent made up at least 50 percent of their monthly pre-tax income.

Name: Jackson Heights
Indicator Description: The share of moderate-income renter households whose gross rent made up at least 50 percent of their monthly pre-tax income.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of city residents who were born in New York State.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of the adult population who have disabilities that impair hearing, vision, ambulation, cognition, self-care, or independent living.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The share of the population that is born outside the United States or Puerto Rico.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator: Households with children under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The percentage of households living with children under 18.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The income earned by the 80th percentile household divided by the income earned by the 20th percentile household for a given geographic area, excluding all households without positive income.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older who are in the civilian labor force, divided by the total number of non-institutionalized people aged 16 years and older.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The median household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The median owner-occupied household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The median renter household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as Asian (non-Hispanic).

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as black (non-Hispanic).

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as Hispanic (of any race).

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of the total population that identifies as white (non-Hispanic).

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: All people, both children and adults, living in a given geographic area.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator: Population aged 25+ with a bachelor's degree or higher
Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have attained a bachelor's degree or higher.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator: Population aged 25+ without a high school diploma
Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have not graduated from high school or received a GED.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The percentage of residents who are aged 65 years and older.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The number of people below the poverty threshold divided by the number of people for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 65 or older below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator: Poverty rate, population under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The number of people under 18 years old below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The probability that two randomly chosen people in a given geographic area will be of a different race.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The share of households that include only one person.

Name: Elmhurst/Corona
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force who are unemployed, divided by the total number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows

Indicator Description: The income earned by the 80th percentile household divided by the income earned by the 20th percentile household for a given geographic area, excluding all households without positive income.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older who are in the civilian labor force, divided by the total number of non-institutionalized people aged 16 years and older.

Indicator Description: The median household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Indicator Description: The median owner-occupied household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The median renter household's total income of all members of the household aged 15 years or older.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows

Indicator Description: All people, both children and adults, living in a given geographic area.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Population aged 25+ with a bachelor's degree or higher

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows

Indicator Description: The percentage of the population aged 25 and older who have not graduated from high school or received a GED.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of people below the poverty threshold divided by the number of people for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 65 or older below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Poverty rate, population under 18 years old
Indicator Description: The number of people under 18 years old below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The probability that two randomly chosen people in a given geographic area will be of a different race.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The share of households that include only one person.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force who are unemployed, divided by the total number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: FHA/VA-backed home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied home, condominium, or cooperative apartment that were insured or guaranteed by the FHA or VA, as reported by HMDA.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Higher-cost refinance loans (% of refinance loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of loan originations, for the refinancing of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of first-lien home purchase loan originations for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, or cooperative apartments  divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Home purchase loans in LMI tracts (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loans, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartments, that were originated for homes in low- to moderate-income census tracts.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Home purchase loans to LMI borrowers (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of owner-occupied units divided by the total number of occupied housing units.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of housings units, which can include a house, apartment, mobile home, group of rooms, or single room that is occupied (or is vacant and intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters.

Indicator: Index of housing price appreciation, condominium
Indicator Description: The average price changes in repeated sales of the same condominiums (index=100 in 2000).

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The rate of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated per 1,000 1-4 family properties and condominium units.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, all residential properties
Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of refinance loans for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments in the given geographic.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of vacant, habitable, for-rent units divided by the number of renter-occupied units plus vacant, habitable, for-rent units.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 1 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 2-4 family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of 5+ family residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of all residential properties that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator Description: The number of transactions of condominiums that have a non-trivial price and the sale must not be marked as 'insignificant' by the Department of Finance.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Serious housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All violations that HPD defines as class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Severe crowding rate (% of renter households)
Indicator Description: The share of all renter households in which there are more than 1.5 household members for each room in the unit.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Total housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All HPD violations defined as class A ('non-hazardous'), class B ('hazardous'), and class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows
Indicator: Population density (1,000 persons per square mile)
Indicator Description: The geographic area's population divided by its land area and is reported in thousands of people per square mile.

Name: Hillcrest/Fresh Meadows

Indicator Description: The number of units authorized by new residential building permits is derived from the building permit and jobs reports of the DOB.

Indicator Description: The number of residential units in buildings issued new certificates of occupancy issued by the DOB each year.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: FHA/VA-backed home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck

Indicator Description: The total number of residential properties that had mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, initial, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had a new filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after at least six years without having any such filings.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: Notices of foreclosure, repeat, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family properties and condominiums that had repeat filing of mortgage foreclosure actions initiated against them after already have such a filing in the previous six years.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notice rate (per 1,000 1-4 family and condo properties)
Indicator Description: The number of pre-foreclosure notices issued per 1,000 1-4 family homes and condominium units.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: Pre-foreclosure notices, 1-4 family and condo properties
Indicator Description: The total number of pre-foreclosure notices issued to homeowners of 1-4 family homes and condominium units. These notices are sent 90 days prior to starting a foreclosure action.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator Description: The total number of 1-4 family buildings that completed the foreclosure process and were acquired by the foreclosing lender.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator Description: The number of refinance loans for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments in the given geographic.

Name: Bayside/Little Neck

Name: Bayside/Little Neck
Indicator: Serious housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)

Name: Bayside/Little Neck

Indicator Description: All violations that HPD defines as class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator: Severe crowding rate (% of renter households)
Indicator Description: The share of all renter households in which there are more than 1.5 household members for each room in the unit.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator: Total housing code violations (per 1,000 privately owned rental units)
Indicator Description: All HPD violations defined as class A ('non-hazardous'), class B ('hazardous'), and class C ('immediately hazardous') that were opened in a given time period, regardless of their current status.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator: Population density (1,000 persons per square mile)
Indicator Description: The geographic area's population divided by its land area and is reported in thousands of people per square mile.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator: Units authorized by new residential building permits
Indicator Description: The number of units authorized by new residential building permits is derived from the building permit and jobs reports of the DOB.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis

Indicator Description: The number of residential units in buildings issued new certificates of occupancy issued by the DOB each year.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator Description: The percentage of workers who commute primarily by foot, bicycle, or public transportation, as a share of all workers over the age of 16 who do not work at home.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator Description: The mean commute time in minutes for commuters residing in the geographic area.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis

Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a half mile walk of a station entrance for the New York City Subway, Long Island Rail Road, PATH, Amtrak, Metro-North Railroad, or Staten Island Railway.

Name: Jamaica/Hollis
Indicator: Residential units within 1/4 mile of a park
Indicator Description: The percentage of residential units that are within a quarter mile of a park.

Indicator Description: The number of serious property crimes, those classified as a major felony as defined by the NYPD, committed in a given geographic area per 1,000 residents.

Indicator Description: The percentage of residents who are aged 65 years and older.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator Description: The number of people below the poverty threshold divided by the number of people for whom poverty status was determined.

Indicator Description: The number of people aged 65 or older below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Queens Village

Indicator Description: The number of people under 18 years old below the poverty line divided by the total population of that age group for whom poverty status was determined.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator Description: The share of households that include only one person.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator Description: The number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force who are unemployed, divided by the total number of people aged 16 years and older in the civilian labor force.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator: FHA/VA-backed home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied home, condominium, or cooperative apartment that were insured or guaranteed by the FHA or VA, as reported by HMDA.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator: Higher-cost home purchase loans (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator: Higher-cost refinance loans (% of refinance loans)
Indicator Description: The percentage of loan originations, for the refinancing of an owner-occupied 1-4 family home, that were reported as 'higher cost' under HMDA.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator Description: The number of first-lien home purchase loan originations for owner-occupied 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, or cooperative apartments  divided by the total number of 1-4 family buildings, condominiums, and cooperative apartments.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator: Home purchase loans in LMI tracts (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loans, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartments, that were originated for homes in low- to moderate-income census tracts.

Name: Queens Village
Indicator: Home purchase loans to LMI borrowers (% of home purchase loans)
Indicator Description: The share of all first-lien loan originations, for the purchase of an owner-occupied 1-4 family building, condominium, or cooperative apartment, that were made to low- to moderate-income borrowers.
